metadata.title: CVE-2015-1159 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the cgi_puts function incgi-bin/template.c in the template engine in CUPS before 2.0.3 allowsremote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the QUERYparameter to help/.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1159` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-bsd - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-client - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-core-drivers - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-daemon - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-ppdc - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
cups-server-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
libcups2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
libcupscgi1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
libcupsimage2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
libcupsmime1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
libcupsppdc1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-0ubuntu1.6').
